event_entity.description: The entity name the event refers to

event_type.description: The event type (e.g. create, update, delete)

timestamp.description: The date and time event was received by webhooks service

created_at.description: The date and time entity was created

updated_at.description: The date and time entity was updated

attributes.description: Arbitrary attributes a product has, that will be displayed in e.g. a sale

anyOf.description: A dictionary <string, string> describing all values for one specific variant

parent.description: Only valid for child products (variant and linked)

oneOf.description: Available options for variant parent products

items.description: Describes a single option with all potential values

oneOf.description: Available children for variant parent products

id.description: Product ressource for full child product

oneOf.description: Name of the child product
Product number of the child product
A dictionary <string, string> describing all values for the specific child
Product barcodes

items.description: The uuid v4 that is generated on the API when a tag is created

linked_products.description: Used to store linked_products (existing (can be any type, including `linked` and embedded (`full` product schema)

amount.description: Either net or gross should be set (not null). Tax will be calculated accordingly automatically. We do not validate for either to be set, for data flexibility reasons.

purchase_price.description: Define the opportunity cost or calculatory base price of this product and currency.

margin.description: Add a margin to pruchase_price and cost to result in net.

amount.description: Either net or gross should be set (not null). Tax will be calculated accordingly automatically. We do not validate for either to be set, for data flexibility reasons.

purchase_price.description: Define the opportunity cost or calculatory base price of this product and currency.

margin.description: Add a margin to pruchase_price and cost to result in net.

amount.description: Either net or gross should be set (not null). Tax will be calculated accordingly automatically. We do not validate for either to be set, for data flexibility reasons.

purchase_price.description: Define the opportunity cost or calculatory base price of this product and currency.

margin.description: Add a margin to pruchase_price and cost to result in net.

amount.description: Either net or gross should be set (not null). Tax will be calculated accordingly automatically. We do not validate for either to be set, for data flexibility reasons.

purchase_price.description: Define the opportunity cost or calculatory base price of this product and currency.

margin.description: Add a margin to pruchase_price and cost to result in net.

stock_maximum.description: The maximum resulting qty a location should have after a reorder

reorder_point.description: The stock level that triggers a reorder

reorder_qty.description: The default qty on any reorder

location.description: Alphanumerical uuid of the location, e.g. branch or warehouse

sellable.description: Define whether a product should be sellable (appears in use cases which assume sale)

purchasable.description: Define whether a product should be purchasable (appears in use cases which assume purchase)

stockable.description: Define whether to keep track of stock of this product.

discountable.description: Define whether this product can receive a discount during a sale.

linkable.description: Define whether a product should be linkable. NOTE: this will replace the type "linked"

categories.description: Defines a list of "Tillhub" categories, which is list of uuids. The category trees will then determine where it is placed.

oneOf.description: The reference to the takeaway tax rate to use it for calculation instead of the regular tax during takeaway checkout process
The reference to the takeaway revenue account to use it instead of the regular revenue account during takeaway checkout process

type.description: variant of a product (product|voucher) or a parent (variant_product|linked_product|composed_product) or a child (variant|linked) where child has "parent" property containing the ID of a parent product or a special product for tipping (tip_owner|tip_employee)

client_id.description: A client definable ID for the purpose of syncing to a client or used in analytics for e.g. transactions that created a product offline and done transactions offline before they received a backend ID.

external_reference_id.description: A caller defined custom ID for the purpose of syncing from external resources, or to use in analytics.

default_tile_color.description: Color to be displayed when no image is set.

oneOf.description: Deprecated, use 'barcodes' instead
determines if stock configurations are handled on global client level or on individual product level
Alphanumerical uuid of the location, e.g. branch or warehouse
The amount/quantity that should be used in a reorder
Threshold at which a reorder should be triggered
The amount/quantity of stock to be created (supported only for bulk creation of products with stock)
An array of uuids of the products service questions
An array of uuids of the products service question groups
An array of uuids of the product addon groups

Can grant external rewards when added to a cart.

NOTE: Should be used sparsely for special campign products that require barcode scanning as sort of campaign activator.
Should be used for products that are bound to specific branch groups.
These products will be currently visible to anyone as there is no dedicated type planned (Summer 2023).
Can grant Coop rewards when added to a cart.
Can grant Coop campaign rewards when part of an active cart.
Start date of the campaign
End date of the campaign

allow_zero_prices.description: Allow adding this product to a cart if it has no price.

allow_is_free.description: If an eligible price is 0 define whether the user is prompted to enter a price or whether the price can stay 0, to essentially be a freebie.

request_input.description:
If true, request cashier input - regardless of the current price value, but pre-filled with it.

NOTE: If false and price is 0 - adds item with 0 price automatically.

zero_input_allowed.description:
Defines whether a requested price input can be confirmed with a zero value or not.

NOTE: Does not affect any zero price behavior directly, just the input validation when 'request_input'=true.

oneOf.description: The amount of loyalty values that a customer receives per product. They will be used then the loyalty system specifies "lookup" as a base in the value configurations. The unit is also determined in the loyalty system configurations.
An array of uuids of the product manufacturers

components.description: An array of components for composed product (the type is "composed_product")

product.description: Linked product UUID which is a component of composed product

quantity.description: The quantity of component in a composed product

delegatable.description: Define whether the product can be delegated to other users at all.

online.description: Define whether this product and it's children (if not specified otherwise) are available online.

oneOf.description: Define whether a product requires to enter a serial number during the sale

shipping_required.description: Define whether this item requires shipping. This usually the case except for digital goods. Tax and tax splits may apply based on region.

oneOf.description: List of other (sub)users that are allowed to read this product. If it is "null" then the product can be read by any of the validated (sub)users.

type.description: Type of the user, that indicates in which table to look up

oneOf.description: When the product was cloned from another account's product, the origin/owner should be listed here.

type.description: Type of the user from whom the product was cloned

value.description: Alphanumeric uuid of the user from whom the product was cloned

product.description: Alphanumeric uuid of the original product from whom it was cloned

oneOf.description: The product IDs given by external systems, e.g. Ecwid.
uuid format for legacy reasons, knowing that the previous type contains it eitherway.

product_id.description: the product ID given by external system, e.g. Ecwid

attributes.description: Arbitrary attributes a product has, that will be displayed in e.g. a sale

anyOf.description: A dictionary <string, string> describing all values for one specific variant

parent.description: Only valid for child products (variant and linked)

oneOf.description: Available options for variant parent products

items.description: Describes a single option with all potential values

oneOf.description: Available children for variant parent products

name.description: any arbitrary name for an addon group that can be displayed in applications.

components.description: An array of components for composed product (the type is "composed_product")

product.description: Linked product UUID which is a component of composed product

quantity.description: The quantity of component in a composed product

delegatable.description: Define whether the product can be delegated to other users at all.

shipping_required.description: Define whether this item requires shipping. This usually the case except for digital goods. Tax and tax splits may apply based on region.

oneOf.description: The product IDs given by external systems, e.g. Ecwid.
uuid format for legacy reasons, knowing that the previous type contains it eitherway.

product_id.description: the product ID given by external system, e.g. Ecwid

oneOf.description: An array of price book entries

price_book.description: The reference to the price book

summary.description: Short summary of the price book item

oneOf.description: The reference to the clients

external_reference_id.description: A caller defined custom ID for the purpose of syncing from external resources, or to use in analytics.

value_type.description: Value types restrict the pricing to the value fields (amount_net & amount_gross or rate). If all of those are set the value_type counts. If there is no value_type, amount fields take precedence.

rate.description: Relative value of this product based on any other applicable price.

discounted_by.description: The discounting applied in the price book item. Positive number means discount, negative means markup. Maximum of 1 means that you can not make a discount higher than the price.

oneOf.description: The three letter [ISO currency](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217) of this item.
